deferred_reason: First SIE run for WF2 -- insufficient history (0 prior runs, minimum 3 required). All parameter tuning suggestions are deferred. This run establishes the baseline.

quality_assessment.grade_rationale: Report passes all 16/16 programmatic validation checks. Full 9-field completeness across all 15 signals. Excellent word count (8,644 words, ~66KB). Strong analytical depth in sections 4-6. Minor deductions for pSST score compression and STEEPs category imbalance (T dominance).

nine_field_completeness.details: All 15 signals contain all 9 required fields (bunryu, chulcheo, haeksim sasilm, jeongyang jipyo, yeonghyangdo, sangse seolmyeong, churon, ihaegwangye-ja, monitoring jipyo). Every field has substantive content, not filler. Signals 11-15 have full depth equal to signals 1-10 (W7 FIXED).

details.imbalance_note: T_Technological dominates at 53.3%. This is structurally expected for arXiv (WF2) given cs.* category dominance, but S_Social (6.7%) and s_spiritual (6.7%) representation is thin. The s_spiritual signal in metadata (count=1) has no corresponding signal block in priority-ranked data -- all 15 signals are classified as T/E/P/S/E_Eco. This is a metadata inconsistency.
details.metadata_discrepancy: priority-ranked-2026-02-13.json steeps_distribution claims s_spiritual=1, but no signal in the signals[] array has steeps=s_spiritual. The report exec summary also claims s(value/ethics)=1 but section 8.2 notes '(no separate detection today, existing tracking maintained)'. This suggests the count was carried from historical tracking, not from today's 15 signals.
details.recommendation: For future scans, ensure steeps_distribution in priority-ranked metadata counts only today's detected signals, not historical tracking states.

details.compression_analysis: 8.5pt spread across 15 signals is moderate compression. The 1.0pt step between most adjacent scores suggests scoring may be over-linear. The top cluster (93.5-90.0, 5 signals) and bottom cluster (87.5-85.0, 5 signals) show reasonable differentiation. W2 (pSST score compression) is PARTIALLY ADDRESSED -- spread improved from prior reports' ~11pt range to a similar range here, but the near-linear stepping (0.5-1.5pt gaps) could benefit from more varied intervals.

impact_scale_consistency.details: All 15 signals use consistent X/10 format. Range: 7/10 to 10/10. No instances of X/5, +X.X, or other inconsistent formats. W1 (Impact scale inconsistency) is CONFIRMED FIXED.

details.quality_note: Cross-impact analysis identifies non-obvious connections (e.g., quantum qubit cloning <-> code security as parallel security-functionality trade-offs). Scenarios are differentiated by probability and timeframe. Section 3 signal evolution tracking is substantive with specific evidence for each state change.

details.bilingual_protocol: Korean primary with English technical terms -- compliant

W1_impact_scale_inconsistency.evidence: All 15 signals use X/10 format consistently (7/10 to 10/10).

W2_psst_score_compression.evidence: 8.5pt spread (85.0-93.5) with near-linear 0.5-1.5pt stepping. Compression is less severe than early reports but still present. The lack of Level 2 advanced scoring data may contribute to ceiling effects.
W2_psst_score_compression.recommendation: Consider enabling Level 2 pSST criteria (methodology, replication, data_transparency under SR; momentum, has_update under TC; semantic_distance, information_gain under DC) for WF2 signals to enable wider differentiation above the 85pt band.

W3_cross_workflow_analysis_formulaic.evidence: This weakness applies to integrated reports, not individual WF reports.

W4_churon_field_too_shallow.evidence: All 15 signals have substantive 'churon' (reasoning/inference) fields with specific predictions, timeframe estimates, and actionable implications. Average length exceeds 100 words per signal.

W5_steeps_category_imbalance.evidence: T_Technological at 53.3% is structurally expected for arXiv. All 6 STEEPs categories are represented, which is the best achievable balance for WF2. s_spiritual representation is nominal (metadata only, no actual signal block).
W5_steeps_category_imbalance.note: STEEPs imbalance in WF2 is a feature of the source, not a quality defect. WF1 and WF3 provide complementary coverage.

W6_unicode_arrow.evidence: All cross-impact pairs use the correct Unicode bidirectional arrow character (U+2194). 5 instances found in section 4.1.

W7_signals_11_15_condensed.evidence: Signals 11-15 have full 9-field treatment with equivalent depth to signals 1-10. Each contains substantive content in all fields including detailed sangse seolmyeong (150+ words) and churon (100+ words).

W8_report_length_disparity.evidence: 8,644 words / 67KB is well above the 5,000-word minimum and provides sufficient depth. Within expected range for a 15-signal WF2 report.

area_1_threshold_tuning.reason: First SIE run. No historical comparison available. Will establish baseline for future runs.
observations: Dedup removed 0 signals this run (arXiv ID exact matching is highly effective for WF2)
All 15 signals passed dedup cascade -- no false positives observed
pSST scores cluster in 85-93.5 range; Level 2 scoring not yet active

area_2_agent_performance.reason: First SIE run. No execution timing data available in standardized format.
observations: Report generation completed successfully on first attempt (no retries needed)

area_3_classification_quality.reason: First SIE run. No human correction data available yet.

baseline_recorded.note: Actual signal count is 15 across 5 categories (not 6). s_spiritual metadata entry is a tracking artifact, not a detected signal.

issues_found.description: STEEPs metadata discrepancy: priority-ranked JSON claims s_spiritual=1 but no signal in the data has steeps=s_spiritual. The report section 8.2 acknowledges this with '(no separate detection today, existing tracking maintained)'. This should be corrected in future runs -- steeps_distribution should reflect only the current scan's signals.
issues_found.recommendation: Fix metadata generation to count actual signal classifications, not carry forward historical categories.

area_4_workflow_efficiency.reason: First SIE run. Phase timing data not available in standardized metrics format.
observations: Signal DB grew from 95 to 110 signals (15 new, 0 duplicates)
5 scan history entries in database spanning 2026-02-03 to 2026-02-13
Scan window correctly set to 48 hours (matching WF2 arXiv lookback)

area_5_hallucination_tracking.reason: First SIE run. Recording baseline indicators.

baseline_recorded.url_format: All 15 signals use valid arxiv.org/abs/YYMM.NNNNN format

observations: All 15 arXiv IDs follow the 2602.NNNNN format consistently
All publication dates fall within the declared scan window (2026-02-10 to 2026-02-12)
Author names appear consistent with arXiv metadata conventions
No signs of fabricated citations or phantom sources
Report correctly notes arXiv preprint limitations in section 7

area_6_source_exploration.reason: Source exploration is WF1-only (workflow independence). WF2 uses arXiv exclusively. No exploration data exists for WF2.
area_6_source_exploration.wf1_exploration_noted: WF1 has exploration data for 2026-02-12 and 2026-02-13 (frontier-selection, candidates, merge-report files observed). This is tracked by WF1's own SIE cycle, not WF2's.

parameter_tuning_suggestions.reason: Requires minimum 3 prior SIE runs with historical metrics. This is run 0 (baseline establishment).

future_candidates.observation: Level 2 scoring is configured as enabled, but actual Level 2 criteria data (methodology, replication, data_transparency for SR; momentum, has_update for TC; semantic_distance, information_gain for DC) does not appear to be actively populated. This may contribute to pSST compression in the 85-93 band.
future_candidates.action_when_eligible: After 3 runs, if pSST compression persists, propose MAJOR change to implement Level 2 data collection in the arXiv scanner pipeline.

future_candidates.observation: Metadata counts include s_spiritual=1 but no actual signal was classified as s_spiritual in this scan.
future_candidates.action_when_eligible: After confirming this is a recurring pattern across 3+ runs, propose MINOR metadata generation fix.

source_promotion_candidates.reason: WF2 uses arXiv exclusively. Source promotion is a WF1 concept (exploration tier to expansion tier). No exploration candidates exist for WF2.

historical_comparison.note: This run establishes the baseline. Historical metrics will be compared starting from SIE run 3.

signal_db_health.note: DB reports 110 total but scan_history adds to 95. The 15-signal gap suggests the 2026-02-05 batch of 35 may include pre-existing signals or there is a counting methodology difference. Not a quality issue but worth noting for future SIE tracking.
signal_db_health.uniqueness: No duplicate arXiv IDs detected in today's 15 signals vs existing DB.

recommendations_for_next_run: Establish standardized quality-metrics JSON output (logs/quality-metrics/workflow-wf2-YYYY-MM-DD.json) for automated SIE trend analysis
Fix steeps_distribution metadata to count only current scan signals (not historical tracking artifacts)
Consider populating Level 2 pSST criteria in arXiv scanner to enable wider score differentiation
After 3 SIE runs with metrics, enable threshold tuning analysis for dedup and confidence parameters
Track pSST score compression trend -- if spread remains under 10pt across 3+ runs, investigate Level 2 activation
